intro: Oenothera micrantha var. exfoliata, commonly known as the exfoliating evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its unique feature is the exfoliating bark, which peels off in thin layers, revealing a colorful inner surface. This variety is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
